metadata.title: CVE-2023-44469 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A Server-Side Request Forgery issue in the OpenID Connect Issuer inLemonLDAP::NG before 2.17.1 allows authenticated remote attackers to sendGET requests to arbitrary URLs through the request_uri authorizationparameter. This is similar to CVE-2020-10770.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemonldap-ng - 2.18.2+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-fastcgi-server - 2.18.2+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-handler - 2.18.2+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-uwsgi-app - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-common-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-handler-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-manager-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-portal-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-ssoaas-apache-client-perl - 2.18.2+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lemonldap-ng package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.2+ds-1').
